column2: Technical Prowess
Picking up a heart conjures a few temporary robots to fight alongside you!
Magic Skin
You gain a bonus perk in future Holy Mountains, but you become terribly cursed...
Demise
You die instantly when under 20% health, but you start your next run with +50 max HP and an extra perk.
Blind Spot
You can see clearly in a large ring around you, and are immune to blindness.
Refreshing Variety
Spell Refreshers may spawn several random spells instead of refreshing your spells.
Uneasy Alliance
Your projectiles will temporarily charm enemies if you are below 20% health.
Lukki Mount
A friendly mountable spider is summoned to assist you.
Kickstraction
Kicking near a wand will instantly remove all of its spells.
Repossession
When an enemy dies, their existing projectiles become friendly.
Fortune Teller
When standing still, you can pay gold to summon a throwable crystal ball.
Silly Straw
When holding a potion, a handy straw gives you extra reach!
Trick Betrayal
Enemy deaths caused by other enemies always count as trick kills, and grant double gold.
Wand Capacity +
All wands have their capacity randomly increased or decreased by up to 4, ignoring caps.
Buyback (One-off)
All the spells in your spell inventory are duplicated, but you must purchase both again!
Mana Heartbreak
Instantly adds 240 mana to the wand, but temporarily decreases its max mana by 60
Muddle Bud
An odd flower that causes enemies to confuse friends for foes
False Swipe
A projectile that deals hefty damage but cannot kill
Rollout
A powerful stone ball that carries you inside of it
Circle of Translocation
A field of phasing magic
Will-o-Wisp
A harmless homing projectile that inflicts a burn
Foam Armor
Gives you temporary foam armor that protects from fire and sludge
Dissolution
A projectile will cause enemies to be weakened and deal less damage for a time
Bramball
A prickly projectile that brambles enemies in place
Bramball with Trigger
A prickly projectile that casts another spell upon collision
Golden Glimmer
Gives a projectile a vibrant golden trail
Alt Fire Toggler
When you right click, switches any toggle Requirement spells between the red and blue state
Alt Fire Toggle Disabler
When you right click, disables all toggle requirement spells until another toggler is cast
Echo Bubble
A shining bubble that echoes the position of its caster
Active Passives
This wand regenerates mana 10% faster for every passive spell on this wand
Diversify
Decreases recharge time by 0.50 if you have 4 or more different spell types on this wand
Dive-bomb
A projectile will swiftly fall if there are any enemies below it
Mix-up
Decreases recharge time if the wand has more projectiles than modifiers; otherwise, increases crit chance
Segmented Shield
An energy shield made of eight different segments
Intensify
A projectile will create twice as much material from trails and other effects
Invisibolt
An entirely invisible projectile
Vibrant Bulb
Increases your movement speed if this wand's mana is at max
Dim Bulb
Increases your movement speed if this wand's mana is not at max
Ominous Orb
A stationary blue orb that grows over time
Ominous Orb with Timer
A stationary blue orb that casts another spell after some time
Toxic Flask
A lobbed flask that consumes added damage to grow its gas cloud
Panic Bomb
A hefty bomb that only detonates once you leave its explosion radius
Critical on toxic
Makes a projectile always do a critical hit on enemies stained with toxic sludge
Hail cloud
Creates a chilly cloud that flings projectile ice
Shock Dart
An electric dart that homes towards enemies linearly
Summon Shield Drone
Creates a clumsy drone that follows you and blocks projectiles
(Interact to continue)
Hello, traveler...
I am a lesser god. One long forgotten.
My influence on this world is running thin.
Please... show your faith in me.
If you bring me an offering... I can regain some of my connection to this world.
And you will be handsomely rewarded.
Shall we begin?
Bring me a wand.
Bring me a potion of blood.
Bring me a potion of mundanium.
Clicking Egg
Holding this odd green egg makes your skin crawl.
Saippuakivi
This slippery stone makes you feel cleaner in its presence.
Futility

A little spider has been trapped inside of this egg for some time now... I fear it may be too weak to hatch.
I tried cracking it with my hands, and a rock, and other things...
but I fear the little friend inside would get shaken up too much if I did.
I would go to the Gods for help, but... they do not seem to favour me lately.
Dear reader... if you find this book, may you ask our Gods for help?
Even if it's just a little spider... it hurts to see it stuck like this. Don't you feel the same?
- Robin, the scholar
Crystal ball
It glows ethereally. Throw it at an enemy to deal heavy damage!
Lovely Die
Its cotton-candy smell warms your heart.
A new friend!
Oh no!
Bye-bye!
Drone
It glows with a strange metallic light.
Shield drone
It faintly hums, ready to take flight again.
Runestone of phasing
Wisdom from beyond:\n'$0'
Do you have perks that rely on luck?\nLucky Clover may help you with those, too...
Creepy Polymorphine can be frozen using toxic sludge.\nBe careful not to unfreeze it!
How does a ghost get tipsy?\nDon't think about it too much.

Remember the theme of three.
Normal, Chaotic, Unstable.
Normal, Giga, Omega.
Nature, Technology, Magic...
Can you find more?
Don't trust the Mini and Bloody treasure chests too much.\nChomp!
Robin was a fool.
Try clicking and dragging an item out of your inventory.\nIf you hit an enemy with it, it will always cause a trick kill.
Propane tanks deal more damage than nukes.\nMaybe Exploding Corpses is worth taking after all.
Look at what you've done.\nYou broke Mana Heart.\nI hope you're happy.
If you kick at the perfect time, you can reflect melee damage.\nYou've probably done it by accident before.
Life Lottery can't be affected by Lucky Clover...\nBut it can be affected by the Curse of Greed.
You can use Kickstraction to steal spells from Holy Mountain wands.\nThough, the Gods may not appreciate such a display...
Not everything is a hint.\nOr, at least, this isn't.
Try combining Heat Wave and Freeze Field. You can pretend like you're ice skating.
Unlockable perks are marked by a blue border.\nIn total, there are 8 of them.\nHow many have you unlocked?
Four thousand years before\nThe Snake saw it all.
In the deepest reaches of Hell...\nIn the highest peak of the Sky...\nYou can find cats.
Zap Tap can block any damage type if you're close enough, not just melee.\nYou'll take some electricity damage as recoil, though!
Chaotic Transmutation has some magical properties...\nTry applying it to plasma or a large sawblade.\nOr use it on Rollout.
Egg in the sky\nEgg in the blood\nEgg in the lava.
At 18 stacks of Fortune Teller, summoning a crystal ball costs just 1 gold!\mAt 3,340 stacks, it becomes completely free!\nPlease don't ever try this.
The explosive damage dealt by a Crystal Ball is equal to 25% of your max HP!
Most 'Circle of' spells cannot have their lifetime increased.\nDon't try to increase the lifetime of any Touch Of spells, either.

FEED THE HUNGER
FEED THE HUNGER
FEED THE HUNGER
FEED THE HUNGER
FEED THE HUNGER
If you haven't already, you should try learning some glyphs!\nFor example, the glyph resembling a small square or a diamond is E.\nTry to see if you can spot it in messages.
Coffee pairs very well with Mystery Fungus.\nTry both Worm Blood + Sand and Sand + Fungus Blood + Toxic Sludge if you want to indulge!
Modifiers can't be applied to the beam of plasma spells.\nYou can apply them to the emitter, however.
Craving a more fancy meal?\nCombine cooked meat with diamond or honey to get a unique material!\nOr just rob a potion-throwing alchemist.
It glows ethereally. Throw it at an enemy to deal heavy damage!
November 11th is a very special day...\nTwo unique materials can show up in potions on that day!\nIn any run, Transmutatium has a rare chance of showing up in a normal potion!
Viscous Liquid has a purely unpleasant texture that makes it feel awful to touch.\nHowever, it has a very satisfying flavour...
Mundanium has many uses. Even if it feels and tastes like oatmeal...\nIt can convert both toxic sludge and swamp into more of itself.\nOr, Flummoxium can be used with it to make Hastium.
Melee Immunity will help against the Hunger...\nBut it won't be enough.
Very rarely, IOU can give you another IOU!\nOr IOU can give you Gamble, which can give you IOU, which can...
The kill requirements of Bloody Bonus can be lowered by collecting certain perks.\nAngry Ghost, Vampirism, More Blood, or More Hatred.\n...But is it worth it?
Fill the skull's eye with water.\nFill the island's cave with blood.
Plasma beams with homing applied can kill almost anything.\nBut that spoils the fun, doesn't it?
There are 6 new unique wands to find throughout the world.\nHave you found them all?\nSacrifice them to the Gods for some spells!
Some breadcrumbs are projectiles.\nSome breadcrumbs are not.
Greed will destroy you in the end.
You have done well, Knower to Be.
Getting here was not an easy task. You know that well.
This world is all for you; you're free to do anything you want.
And yet you advance. As you always do.
A whole world to yourself. And you're not satisfied?
No, of course you're not. I expected as much.
Fortunately, I have another reward prepared.
Claim your real reward, then.
Suojapukuhiisi
Hornasuojapukuhiisi
Viisaudenmestari
Hankaussähkö
Book
Technical Treasure Chest

Not enough gold!
Check the mod settings menu for Graham's Things - new settings were added!
You feel like you find spiders a little bit less scary now...
Somehow, you feel a sense of longing after your quest is over.

Foamed
You are immune to fire and toxicity, and gain extra max health for a time.
